intro: Commicarpus brandegeei subsp. glabrior, commonly known as the smooth commicarpus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and smooth, glabrous leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in shrubland or open woodland habitats. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that splits open to release seeds, a common reproductive strategy in the Rhamnaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat endangered species.
